Package jpigpio.devices

Class NRF24L01

java.lang.Object
jpigpio.devices.NRF24L01
public class NRF24L01
extends java.lang.Object
The NRF24L is a wireless communication device.
Author:
kolban

    Set payload (packet) size for specific pipe
    void setRADDR​(byte[] adr)
    Sets receiving address P1.
    void setRegisterBits​(int reg, byte bits)
    Set specified bits in single-byte register
    void setRetries​(int delay, int count)
    Configure delay between retransmissions and number of retransmissions.

    Set 1500uS (minimum for 32B payload in ESB@250KBPS) timeouts, to make testing a little easier
    WARNING: If this is ever lowered, either 250KBS mode with AA is broken or maximum packet sizes must never be used.
    void setTADDR​(byte[] adr, boolean setP0Too)
    Sets the transmitting address.
    java.lang.String setupRetrToString​(byte value)  
    void startListening()
    Tell NRF24 to start listening.

    Start generating testing unodulated carrier wave.
    java.lang.String statusToString​(byte status)  
    void stopListening()
    Stops receiving.
    void stopTestCarrier()
    Stop generating testing carrier wave
    void terminate()
    Terminate connection to nRF24 chip
    boolean testRPD()
    Test whether a signal (carrier or otherwise) greater than or equal to -64dBm is present on the channel.
    int write​(byte[] value)
    Send data packet.
    void writeByteRegister​(int reg, byte value)
    Writes value to single-byte register.
    void writeRegister​(int reg, byte[] data)
    Writes provided bytes into MiRF registers starting from provided register address.
    Good for multi-byte registers.

  • Method Details

    • init

      public boolean init​(int cePin, int csnPin) throws PigpioException
      Initialize nRF24 chip and set the defaults
      Parameters:
      cePin - gpio pin connected to CE
      csnPin - gpio pin connected to CSN
      Returns:
      true if initialized successfully
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • reset

      public void reset() throws PigpioException
      Set initial chip parameters according to nRF24 documentation
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • terminate

      public void terminate() throws PigpioException
      Terminate connection to nRF24 chip
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • config

      public void config​(int payloadSize) throws PigpioException
      Configure the parameters of the device.
      Parameters:
      payloadSize - Number of bytes in payload pipe 0 and pipe 1.
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • setRADDR

      public void setRADDR​(byte[] adr) throws PigpioException
      Sets receiving address P1.
      Parameters:
      adr -
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • setTADDR

      public void setTADDR​(byte[] adr, boolean setP0Too) throws PigpioException
      Sets the transmitting address. Note: RX_ADDR_P0 must be set to the sending addr for auto ack to work.
      Parameters:
      adr - TX address
      setP0Too - if true, set RX_ADDR_P0 to TX address too (for auto ack to work)
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • setChannel

      public void setChannel​(int ch) throws PigpioException
      Set frequency channel nRF24 operates on
      Parameters:
      ch - channel 0-127
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • setDataRate

      public void setDataRate​(int dataRate) throws PigpioException
      Sets data rate
      Parameters:
      dataRate - datarate to use RF24_250KBPS = 250 kbit/s RF24_1MBPS = 1 Mbit/s RF24_2MBPS = 2 Mbit/2*
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • setPALevel

      public void setPALevel​(int level) throws PigpioException
      Sets TX output power level.
      Parameters:
      level - TX output power level RF24_PA_MIN = -18db RF24_PA_LOW = -12db RF24_PA_HIGH = -6db RF24_PA_MAX = 0db
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • setAutoACK

      public void setAutoACK​(boolean enable) throws PigpioException
      Enable or disable automatic packet acknowledgements. Default is ENABLE.
      Parameters:
      enable - true to enable, false to disable
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • setAutoACK

      public void setAutoACK​(int pipe, boolean enable) throws PigpioException
      Enable or disable automatic packet acknowledgements for specific pipe.
      Parameters:
      pipe - true to enable, false to disable
      enable -
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • setPayloadSize

      public void setPayloadSize​(int size) throws PigpioException
      Set payload (packet) size for all pipes
      Parameters:
      size - payload size 1-32 bytes
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • setPayloadSize

      public void setPayloadSize​(int pipe, int size) throws PigpioException
      Set payload (packet) size for specific pipe
      Parameters:
      pipe - pipe 0-5
      size - payload size 1-32 bytes
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • getPayloadSize

      public int getPayloadSize()

    • disableCRC

      public void disableCRC() throws PigpioException
      Disable CRC
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • setCRCSize

      public void setCRCSize​(int crcSize) throws PigpioException
      Set CRC size
      Parameters:
      crcSize - CRC size in bytes (0 = disable, 1 = 8 bits, 2 = 16 bits)
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • setRegisterBits

      public void setRegisterBits​(int reg, byte bits) throws PigpioException
      Set specified bits in single-byte register
      Parameters:
      reg - register to set
      bits - bits to set
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • clearRegisterBits

      public void clearRegisterBits​(int reg, byte bits) throws PigpioException
      Clear specified bits in single-byte register
      Parameters:
      reg - register to set
      bits - bts to clear
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • setRetries

      public void setRetries​(int delay, int count) throws PigpioException
      Configure delay between retransmissions and number of retransmissions.

      Set 1500uS (minimum for 32B payload in ESB@250KBPS) timeouts, to make testing a little easier
      WARNING: If this is ever lowered, either 250KBS mode with AA is broken or maximum packet sizes must never be used. See documentation for a more complete explanation.
      Parameters:
      delay - How long to wait between each retry, in multiples of 250us, max is 15. 0 means 250us, 15 means 4000us.*
      count - Number of retries (0 = no retries, max 15 retries)
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • dataReady

      public boolean dataReady() throws PigpioException
      Checks if data is available for reading in RX FIFO
      Returns:
      true if there is data available for reading
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • rxFifoEmpty

      public boolean rxFifoEmpty() throws PigpioException
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • getData

      public boolean getData​(byte[] data) throws PigpioException
      Read data received into the array
      Parameters:
      data - The array of data to be returned.
      Returns:
      true if there is more data to read
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • configRegister

      public void configRegister​(int reg, byte value) throws PigpioException
      (DEPRECATED) Write single byte to specified register.
      Use method writeByteRegister instead.
      Parameters:
      reg - registe to write to
      value - new value
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • readByteRegister

      public byte readByteRegister​(int reg) throws PigpioException
      Reads single one-byte register
      Parameters:
      reg - register to read
      Returns:
      register value
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • readRegister

      public void readRegister​(int reg, byte[] value) throws PigpioException
      Reads an array of bytes from the given start position in the MiRF registers.
      Parameters:
      reg - starting register
      value - array of bytes to store read values to
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • writeRegister

      public void writeRegister​(int reg, byte[] data) throws PigpioException
      Writes provided bytes into MiRF registers starting from provided register address.
      Good for multi-byte registers. For single-byte registers you can use method writeByteRegister.
      Parameters:
      reg - starting register
      data -
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • writeByteRegister

      public void writeByteRegister​(int reg, byte value) throws PigpioException
      Writes value to single-byte register. For multi-byte registers you can use method writeRegister.
      Parameters:
      reg - register to write to
      value - new register value
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • write

      public int write​(byte[] value) throws PigpioException
      Send data packet. This is a blocking call, but 60ms max, so no big deal.
      Parameters:
      value - data to send
      Returns:
      0 if OK, 1 if number of retries reached, 2 if timeout occurred
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • send

      public void send​(byte[] value) throws PigpioException
      Send up to 32 bytes of data.
      Parameters:
      value - The data to send.
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • isSending

      public boolean isSending() throws PigpioException
      Test if chip is still sending. When sending has finished return chip to listening.
      Returns:
      true if data is currently being transmitted
      Throws:
      PigpioException - on pigpiod error

    • getStatus

      public byte getStatus() throws PigpioException
      Read STATUS register
      Returns:
      value stored in STATUS register
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • getConfig

      public byte getConfig() throws PigpioException
      Read CONFIG register
      Returns:
      value stored in CONFIG register
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • getChannel

      public byte getChannel() throws PigpioException
      Get frequency channel nRF24 chip is currently using
      Returns:
      used frequency channel number
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • getAddressWidth

      public int getAddressWidth() throws PigpioException
      Return address width in bytes
      Returns:
      address width in bytes (3-5)
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • getRXAddresses

      public byte[][] getRXAddresses() throws PigpioException
      Read addresses receiver is listening from
      Returns:
      array containing addresses of reading pipes 0-5
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • getTXAddress

      public byte[] getTXAddress() throws PigpioException
      Read transmitter address - source address
      Returns:
      transmitter address
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • setAddressWidth

      public void setAddressWidth​(int width) throws PigpioException
      Set RX/TX address width.
      Parameters:
      width - Width in bytes. Allowed values are 3,4,5.
      Throws:
      PigpioException

      PigpioException

    • startListening

      public void startListening() throws PigpioException
      Tell NRF24 to start listening. Power up and set to RX Mode. Flushes both RX and TX FIFOs. Resets STATUS register flags.
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • stopListening

      public void stopListening() throws PigpioException
      Stops receiving. Go from active RX Mode to to Standby-I Mode. Flushes both RX and TX FIFOs.
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • powerDown

      public void powerDown() throws PigpioException
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • startTestCarrier

      public void startTestCarrier​(int channel, int powerLevel) throws PigpioException
      Start generating testing unodulated carrier wave. For testing purposes only.
      Parameters:
      channel - RF channel to start carrier wave on
      powerLevel - power level for carrier wave
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • stopTestCarrier

      public void stopTestCarrier() throws PigpioException
      Stop generating testing carrier wave
      Throws:
      PigpioException

    • testRPD

      public boolean testRPD() throws PigpioException
      Test whether a signal (carrier or otherwise) greater than or equal to -64dBm is present on the channel. Valid only on nRF24L01P (+) hardware. Useful to check for interference on the current channel and channel hopping strategies.
      Returns:
      true if signal => -64dBm, false if not
      Throws:
      PigpioException

      public java.lang.String statusToString​(byte status)

      public java.lang.String dataRateToString​(int dataRate)

      public void printDetails​(java.io.PrintStream prn)
      Print detailed information about nRF24 chip
      Parameters:
      prn - PrintStream to which data will be sent
